title: ‘Misleading and unfounded’ — JAMB dismisses claims of hike in UTME registration fee
desc: The Joint Admission and Matriculation Board (JAMB) has dismissed reports insinuating it has increased the registration fees for Unified Tertiary Matriculation Examinations (UTME), describing the claim as “false, misleading and entirely unfounded”.

title: The impact of the Fallout TV series on PC game sales from 2024
desc: Data from digital entertainment marketplace G2A.com shows the significant effect the Fallout TV show has had on the franchise's PC game sales across both seasons. This analysis covers individual SKUs and cumulative sales over two years.

title: High number of chikungunya cases reported among travellers returning from Seychelles: local transmission in mainland Europe currently unlikely
desc: Since November 2025, more than 70 travel-related cases among travellers returning from Seychelles have been reported by 10 European countries.
source: European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control

title: Eight months’ jail for private-hire driver who ran red light and killed motorcyclist
desc: A private-hire driver received eight months' jail and an eight-year driving ban for a fatal traffic accident caused by running a red light. Read more at straitstimes.com.

title: Queensland Reds defeat Highlanders, Western Force beat Moana Pasifika in Super Rugby
desc: The Queensland Reds and Western Force have recorded their first wins of the Super Rugby Pacific season in round three.

title: 2 measles cases aboard SIA flight to New Zealand infected before arrival in Singapore: CDA
desc: Two individuals infected with measles developed symptoms on an SIA flight to New Zealand after transiting through Changi Airport from India. Read more at straitstimes.com.
